page.title: 08NORTH SEA GAS REFINERY
page.content: {BACKGROUND}The oil industry began to take a serious interest in the North Sea in 1959,when one of the largest gas fields in the world was discovered at Groningen in Holland.This discovery,in similar formations to a much smaller gas field at Eskdale near the Yorkshire coast,suggested at the strata underlying the southern North Sea might be a source of oil or gas. {THE WEST SOLE GAS FIELD}The West Sole gas field was discovered in September 1965,was the first commercial in the North Sea and the first to start feeding natural gas into the national grid.The Rough field was discovered later and was developed by Amaco.This field is now empty and is being used by British Gas as a storage facility. British Gas have built a huge compression and cleaning facility in our area.
